alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 10:22AM MST until December 25 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 6 to 18 inches, mainly above 8000 feet, with locally higher totals near Brian Head and in the Tushars. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Central Mountains and Southern Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM today to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially over SR- 14 Cedar Canyon Summit, and SR-143 Summit. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Period of heaviest snow expected this evening through early Friday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
